slides.title: Hyperlinks Basics
slides.content: # Links (Hyperlinks) ğŸ”— Links are the essence of the World Wide Web. They allow users to click their way from page to page. ## The Tag HTML links are defined with the `` tag: ```html link text ``` The `href` attribute specifies the destination address. ```html Visit Google ```

slides.title: The 'target' Attribute
slides.content: # The Target Attribute ğŸ¯ The `target` attribute specifies where to open the linked document. - `_self`: Default. Opens in the same window/tab. - `_blank`: Opens in a new window or tab. - `_parent`: Opens in the parent frame. - `_top`: Opens in the full body of the window. ```html Visit W3Schools! ``` > ğŸ’¡ **Tip:** Use `_blank` for external links to keep users on your site.

slides.title: Absolute vs Relative URLs
slides.content: # Absolute vs Relative URLs ğŸ“ ## Absolute URLs A full web address (e.g., `https://www.google.com`). Used for external links. ```html Google ``` ## Relative URLs A local path (e.g., `page2.html`). Used for internal links within your website. ```html About Us Logo ```

slides.content: # Email Links âœ‰ï¸ Use `mailto:` inside the `href` attribute to open the user's email program. ```html Send email ``` You can even add a subject: ```html Send email with subject ```

slides.content:
